messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Asteroids, which are rocks that fly through space, are being studied by NASA. The agency is now working to record data about smaller asteroids that are 140 metres wide or more. Although scientists believe there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size, they have only found about 8,000 so far. This is a serious danger because when a much smaller asteroid exploded over a Russian city in 2013, it injured 1,200 people.
Feedback received: Grade 1/10 - FAIL

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is currently working to log asteroids, which are rocks that fly through space, focusing on those that measure 140 metres wide or more. Although it is estimated that there are 25,000 asteroids of this size, only about 8,000 have been logged so far, which leaves 17,000 unaccounted for. These asteroids would be a serious danger if they entered Earth's orbit, because a much smaller asteroid injured 1,200 people when it exploded over a Russian city in 2013.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: The submission failed the Preliminary Metrics Check. The text was classified as B2 level, which does not match the target B1 level. The use of multiple complex sentences with non-defining relative clauses (e.g., '...asteroids, which are rocks...') and subordinate conjunctions (e.g., 'Although...') demonstrates a proficiency level higher than the B1 requirement.
